subject: AI & Agents
title: Cross-Validation: Testing Without Waste
description: A quick, practical guide to Cross-Validation: Testing Without Waste.

hook.text: You only have 1,000 examples. Holding out 200 for testing wastes 20% of your precious data.

buildup.text: Cross-validation splits data into k folds, trains on k-1, and tests on the remaining fold.

discovery.text: Rotate through all folds so every example gets to be in the test set exactly once.

twist.text: It's slower â€” you train k models instead of one. But the evaluation is far more reliable.

climax.text: Five-fold cross-validation is the standard for reporting results in machine learning research.

punchline.text: Use all your data for training AND testing. Just not at the same time.

quiz.question: What is the benefit of cross-validation?
options: It uses all data for both training and testing
It eliminates the need for test data
